title: Federal Student Loan Defaults Down
teaser: The drop has been attributed to an improving economy and increasing enrollment in federal debt-forgiveness programs.
contentencoded:
The Department of Education this week reported that the number of Americans defaulting on their student loans is falling.

The drop has been attributed to an improving economy and increasing enrollment in federal debt-forgiveness programs.

The Atlantic’s Derek Thompson joins Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson to explain.

Guest

  • Derek Thompson, senior editor for The Atlantic. He tweets @DKThomp.
